posts.caption:
I really love Ashtanga yoga at the moment. The more I practice it, the more I love it. A few years ago I thought Ashtanga is the least suitable yoga style for me. I wanted a variable and free practice, a calm and slow Yin or a creative Vinyasa flow. But nowadays it's the opposite. I think there are a few reasons...
❤
1. I found a good teacher and a good place to learn.
2. I found Mysore style which suits me very well. (Mysore is a teacher-assisted, self-led approach to practicing yoga asanas)
3. I love that I have the same routine, same sequence to go through daily. My life is (very) chaotic... everyday is different and it's difficult to have routines. I love that I know my practice well, what I'm going to do next.
4. Ashtanga gives me a lot of challenges! Endless learning. I’ve already noticed I’m improving and it's an amazing feeling. Like this week when I was able to do something new it gave me so much energy.
5. Last but most important, the more familiar I become with my asana practice (which happens everytime) The more I can focus on my breathing. It's becoming also more meditative all the time.
❤
So never say never. I suggest to give a second opportunity to different yoga styles! ❤ What is your favorite at the moment? 😊
❤️
My art inspiration account @nudeyogagirl_art

I believe that we belong in nature and we stay too much inside. I do. Connecting with nature is healthy. Fresh air, different stimulus, birds singing... Less stress for sure! But why I love nature the most?! Maybe because it gives me a more "wow" effect than anything else. Beautiful sunsets, fog on the mountains, shapes of clouds, colorful flowers, waterfalls and waves, endless horizonons and smooth stones... I could continue much longer! This Mexican cenote in the middle of the jungle is one of the most beautiful places I’ve ever seen. Art of nature. ❤
Do you think you spend enough time in nature?😊
❤️
My art inspiration account @nudeyogagirl_art

I’ve never seen this many secluded beaches... just a few people around, early in the morning there is no one. I’m loving Sardinia so much! Today is our last day but we will be back. ❤
❤️
Where in the world are you right now!? 😊

I find it sometimes very difficult to just be in the moment without thinking about what’s coming next... to do lists, tasks, schedules. But mainly wondering if I’ve been or will be good enough in the things I do. Why can't I just live in the moment and enjoy?! On our photography trip in Koh Samui I felt I was able to achieve it! I was much more at peace even if we were quite busy... I want to challange myself to not stress or worried about anything that is about to come also here at home. Concentrate more on the now! JUST NOW! ❤️
📷
Photo taken at the amazing hillside villa @villablueview / @theluxenomad / @lvh_villas
#villablueview #theluxenomad #luxuryvillasandhomes

I was at my parent's place and I found my old storage box. With many notebooks inside... They were not even that old, I wrote in some of them just 5 years ago. I was a bit shocked after I started reading... houndreds of pages of food diary. Year after year, day after day. I was counting calories, points or carbohydrates etc.
❤
Many notebooks started with a straigt line, on the otherside was my current weight and on the otherside my goal weight. I measured myself like the modeling world teched me. I marked if I had taken any food supplements or drank enough water, I gave grades to how my day went. I rated my life according to what I ate and my workouts?!
❤
The worst thing... there was a photo of myself modeling and some photos that I had cut from magazines of skinny supermodels. I had written next to my photo: I DON'T WANT TO LOOK LIKE THIS. And next to the other photo... I want to look like this, and then there was this "thinspiration" photo.
❤️
How sad. I hated my body for so many years. I was too big, my boobs were too small. I was ashamed of my body, and I was sure everybody looked at me like I saw myself. I controlled my eating for years but only nowadays understand how unhealthy it was.
❤
I was never diagnosed with eating disorder but now I think maybe I've had at least some kind of orthorexia for a while. After trying to be as skinny as possible I became obsessed of being as toned as I can and I started to aim for muscels at the gym.
❤
Why do I want to share this? Because yoga has helped me the most. After finding yoga to my everyday life, I lost my interest in my weight and the measurements of my body. I haven't weighed myself for at least three years now. These things don't define anymore who I am. "You are beautiful exactly the way you are." ❤️
.
.
.
#yoga #NYGyoga #selfacceptance
One question once a week... How old are you? ❤ I’m 28. I would like to get to know you a little bit better. 😊 #yoga #jump #artist

My last 30 days... Yoga classes and skipping them.🙈 One interview (Brazil). Family day in the city where I live. A few essays for my yoga teacher training. Stressing if I will learn enough in time to be able to teach others well. Many photos and photoshoots. Being happy of the most ordinary moments. Going to the gym, hill runs on the mountains.Three weeks in Italy. Too much pasta, pizza and risotto. A new yoga mat (do you have a favorite one!?). Listened to two audiobooks. Friends. Visiting Sardinia with my boyfriend. Meeting deadlines - late nights because of them. Spending a lot of time in nature. A lot of environment and climate change talk...Debating about it! One movie night. One concert in a church. Worried about hair loss. Zero clothes shopping.
❤
What comes to your mind if you think about the last 30 days?

At the moment I feel like I need extra hours for each day! I’m busy all day and my to do-lists are way too long. But the feeling is also because there is so much things I would like to learn, do, read, see, visit, try... As an entrepreneur my work never really finishes and I never get bored. It's hard for a bit of a perfectionist when we can't do all the things as well as we would like to. I’ve tried and learned to take tasks less seriously and prioritize also social things. But I still have the feeling that life is too hectic and I’m finding it a bit hard to calm my mind. And I don't have even kids yet! 😊 I think it's not only my lifestyle but my personality type!
❤
I wanted to ask you: What do you do or think to relax and slow down during busy periods? I hope everyone could pick up some tips in the comments instead of my caption as this is something I struggle with. ❤

I really feel that I want to discuss climate change with you. Today I just wish I would have better english skills to write what I want... I'm anxious and worried about the world situations... Are you too?!
🌱
After the new report of climate change we all really should start doing what we can. All companies, customers, individuals, everyone... We have only 12 years to limit the climate change catastrophe. We have known for 50-60 years about global warming and still we’ve made the situation just worst.
🌱
Today I'm very happy that I’ve decided to keep this account out of materials and commercial products - but I know that travelling is something that I need to reduce. I'm already almost vegan and prefer local food, I don't own car... but still I can do a lot more besides reducing flying: buy less, recycle better, take shorter showers, avoid plastic even more.. etc. I think having a large following gives me responsibility to write about these things more and give an example.
🌱
I want to challenge you to do so also! Have you decided to change your lifestyle in some way into a more sustainable one? ❤️

True freedom begins the moment you have nothing to hide. ❤️

My alarm goes off at 6 am but I’m not an early morning person so I will stay in bed a few minutes more. 😉 I wash my face first and then do my "nude yoga girl hair": low bun as you can see in most of my pics! I drink a small cup of coffee which my boyfriend prepares. I get on my yoga mat and my way to warm up is usually sun salutations... I should warm up more but I can’t wait to start to photograph! We take nude yoga photos from about 7 to 9 every morning...
❤
My daily morning routine here in Koh Samui ends in a slow breakfast with a lot of fruit! I love to have this routine here! ❤
📷
We took this photo five days ago at the beautiful beachfront villa @chaitalayestate / @chaitalayretreats

A kind answer to all the people who ask me to show my face... ❤ Ps. It’s there, I’m just bending back. 😊

Many prefer black&white and many prefer color photos. What do you like the most?
❤
This photo was taken a few years ago in Bali... I haven't published it yet because I can’t decide if it’s too much! I feel like this many times actually - I wonder if I'm too used to being nude? But it's just our natural state.
❤
Ps. I started writing and combined a blog to my art gallery. Have I ever been “caught” during nude yoga? I get asked this a lot! Yes, a few times... There was one extremely awkward moment for all the three of us! Read about it at nudeyogagirl.com (link in bio) or see link in my IG stories...😊

From this morning here in Sardinia! 😊It has been a very fun and productive trip - I love this island! It’s so full of different kind of nature from stunning beaches to rocks and mountains. This time we aren't here only to create photos... but I'm so happy that we managed (found an isolated place!) to get some new ones today. Color photos also coming up soon. 😊 Hugs! ❤

We took this photo in our backyard in Italy a few days ago. But now we are visiting Sardinia for the first time! Like you maybe have seen on my IG Stories. 😊 Such an amazing place - even if today has been rainy! I wanted to say quickly hi to you before dinner and just ask how are you? 😊❤

A moment in Lapland around midnight. It wasn't even dark because we were so up north, in July. It was super quiet. The air was almost warm. I was standing on this secluded dock and I didn't see any movement, only forest around. The water was so still that it was like mirror. We didn't have much time to take photos but I didn't feel busy at all. How could I in a place like this... ❤️
My art account @nudeyogagirl_art

So have fun and I can’t wait to see and read your post! ❤
